page.title: 07LOWER HARDRES SCHOOL
page.content: The red brick one-storey school was built in 1846. Today Lower Hardres Primary School has 19 pupils aged from 5 to 11 years. The Headmistress is assisted by one full time teacher. Two pre-fabricated classrooms have been added. There is a netball pitch, grass playing field with adventure play ground and sandpit. For nature study a small pond with plant life has been created. Some extra activities have been a study of pigs with a visit to a local farm.Also visits to Canterbury Cathedral and the London zoo. A BBC computer, monitor and disc drive were borrowed for two weeks and it is hoped to purchase this equipment so that pupils may consolidate basic work. At the age of 11 pupils go on to Grammar or Secondary Schools in Canterbury. A few attend Chartham Secondary School.
